A BUNCH OF.Definition: a lot of or a group of

KNITTING.Definition: making clothes or fabric with needles and wool

OBSCURE.Definition: not well known, hard to understand

BOND.Definition: a kind of loan or promise of money, usually from a government or company

SAW THE LIGHT OF DAY.Definition: were shown or used in public

SEASONED.Definition: experienced, having listened to it many times

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: rich people with high social rank, often from old families

CANDIDATE.Definition: choice, someone or something that could be picked

DIVISIVE.Definition: causing people to split into groups and argue

FLOODING.Definition: filling, coming in very large numbers

STANDALONE.Definition: intended or designed to be used or to function alone or separately

SKIMMING OVER.Definition: reading quickly to get the main idea

BULLET POINTS.Definition: short simple lines of text used to list things

CHRONOLOGICAL.Definition: in time order, from earliest to latest

DUMBING DOWN.Definition: making it simpler so it is easier to understand

DUPLICATES.Definition: words or phrases that have appeared more than once

TENDS.Definition: usually does, is likely to happen

TRIALLED.Definition: tested to see if it worked well

WRITER’S BLOCK.Definition: when a writer cannot think of what to write

BACK ON TRACK.Definition: to the right path or plan

SOUNDING BOARD.Definition: something I use to test my ideas

NARRATIVE ARC.Definition: the way a story develops from beginning to end

CLICKBAITY.Definition: a design to get attention in a cheap or tricky way
